txt:
Okay, the reason why I asked you guys out to brunch today is because I
have been doing some thinking about who should be my maid of honor.

Oh my God! This is it! (She and Phoebe hold hands.) (To Phoebe) I really
hope it’s you!
I hope it’s you.
Me too!

First of all um, I love you both so much and you’re both so
important to me…
Okay, bla-bla-bla-bla!! Who is it?!

Well umm, I was thinking that maybe we could come up with a system where
we trade of being maid of honor for each other. Like hypothetically, if Phoebe were
mine…
Yes!!! Oh!!
Hypothetically!
Still.
If Phoebe were my maid of honor…
Uh-hmm.

Rachel would be Phoebe’s, I would be Rachel’s, that way we all
get to do it once and no one would get upset.
Yeah that’s actually a pretty good idea.
Yeah, I’ll do that. So who gets to be yours?
(laughs) Well that’s the best part. Umm,
Wh-why is that the best part?
Because then I don’t have to!
Well of
I’m really not deciding!
Fine!

Excuse me, I-I couldn’t help overhearing, you’re marrying Chandler
Bing?
Yeah that’s right.
(sarcastically) Huh, good luck!
Aww, and good luck to you too! (To Monica and Rachel) What a nice lady!
Yep. Hey, what do you say we make it a double feature?
What’d you rent?
(looking at the tape) Joey, this is
Oh, well we watch it a second time and its
Joey, we
And?
And it’ll be cool to see it again! Yeah!
Dude, you didn’t say
Yeah, I just got uh, got plans.
Well, John McLane had plans!

No, see the thing is I want to get out of here before Joey gets all
worked up and starts calling everybody bitch.
What are you talking about? Bitch.
Hey Rachel?
Yeah?
Umm, when I get married will you be my maid of honor?
Really?!
Uh-hmm.

Oh my God Phoebe! I mean I’m just—Wait a minute. If I’m
your maid of honor that means you are Monica’s.
Oh! Well, if that’s what you want…
Ohh! No way Phoebe! I want to be Monica’s!
But why does it even matter?!
Why does it matter so much to you?!
Because
What-what if I marry Ross—Or Joey?

(gasps) You wouldn’t! Okay look, Rachel I know you really want to
do this, but I-I’ve never been maid of honor to anyone before! And I know you’ve
done it at least twice!
Yeah but Phoebe…

And no, oh please, oh please let me finish. (Rachel stops talking.) Oh I
guess that was it.

Okay. Okay. It’s—since you’ve never done it before you
can be Monica’s made of honor.
Oh, thank you so much! (They hug.) Okay.
I’m gonna marry someone good y’know.
Oh I know.

Better than Chandler. (Phoebe exhales as if to say, "Like what
isn’t?")
Die Hard
What happened?!!
Well, I don’t know!!
We fell asleep! That is all.
Yeah. Yep. Yeah. All right, well uh, I’d better go.
I think that would be best.
Yeah. All right, I’ll talk to you later.
Okay. But not about this!
No! Never! Never! (Pause, then Joey wants to shake Ross’s hand.) Bye.
No touch! No touch!

Yeah hey, a weird thing happened today whey I was at brunch. This woman
overheard that I was marrying you and-and then she…she wished me good luck.
That’s sweet.
No, it’s more like a (sarcastically) good luck.
So uh, what did this woman look like?
She was like 30, dark hair, attractive.

Well, is there any chance you were looking into a bright, shiny thing
called a mirror?
Come on, was it somebody maybe you dated in college?

No, no I only dated two girls in college, both blonde, both not
attractive… (Thinks a little while.) Hold on one second; let me check this out. (He
gets up and grabs a photo album.
What are you doing?

Well, let’s see… (Finding the picture he wants.) Okay uh, is
that her? (Pointing to the picture.)
Oh my God yes! Who is she?
Julie Grath, my camp girlfriend.
Did you break up with her?

(pause) No, we’re still together. Yeah we went out for two
summers, and then I broke up with her.
Why?

Well, ‘cause she came back the third summer and she’d gotten
really fa-aa-aw-ow…
Fat?!
I did not say fat! I said, "Fa-aa-aw-ow…"
You broke up with a girl because she was fat?!

Yeah. Yeah, but it was a really, really long time ago! Does she still
feel bad?
Well, apparently she does.

Well, you know what they say, elephants never forget. (Monica is not
amused by that statement.) Seriously, good luck marrying me.
Hey! What’s going on?
Phoebe is gonna be Monica’s maid of honor!

Hey! Well I hope it goes better than the last time you did it for that
girl downstairs, remember? (Phoebe glares at him.)
(shocked)
See? This is exactly why you shouldn’t lie!
All right that’s it!
Na-uh,
How come you are?!
Because I cared enough to lie!

Hey-hey-hey-hey, I can help you decide who should do it! Yeah, we could
have like uh, like an audition and see how you’d handle maid of honor type
situations.
What are you talking about?

Like when I want a job, I go to an audition and if I’m the best of
the people they see, they give me the part.
Okay, so after this audition, who decides who gets it?
Oh uh, me and Ross can be the judges.
(To Rachel) Well, it’s better than us deciding.
Oh, come on! This is crazy! Can’t we just flip a coin?!
No! Coins hate me!

Okay. Okay fine, y’know what? We will let Ross and Joey decide.
(Ross enters.) (In a sexy voice.) Hiiiii, Ross! Sweetie.
Hey there, you handsome thing. (Rachel and Phoebe exit.)
Wow, this cologne really
Hi.
Just uh, brought back your videos.
Uh hey look uh Ross, look I think we need to talk about before.
No! No we don’t!
Yes we do! Now look, that was the best nap I ever had!!
I… I don’t know what you are talking about.
Come on! Admit it! That was the best nap you ever had!
I’ve had better.
Okay! When?!
All right! All right! It was the best nap ever!
Uh-huh!
I’ve said it! Okay?! But it’s over Joey!
I want to do it again.
We
Why not?
Because it’s weird!
Fine! Do you want something to drink?
Sure, what do you got?
Warm milk and

Chandler! (Knocks on the door.) Chandler! I just figured out who you
are!
Can you figure out what I’m doing?
You’re Lewis Posin.
Who?

Lewis Posin! He was my best friend in fifth grade, and-and then one day
I asked him to be my boyfriend and he said no. Do you know why?

Because you kept talking to him while he was trying to go to the
bathroom?!

No! But because he thought I was to faaaaa…. (Chandler emerges,
without flushing by the way.) And every time I think about it, it makes me feel as bad as
I did in fifth grade! Y’know, I-I really think that you should apologize to Julie.
What? Are you kidding? That was like 16 years ago.

No, I know. But y’know what? It would make me feel better if Lewis
apologized to me.

Okay, I will do it. But I have to warn you; this may make me a better
person and that is

Okay, all right, this is how it’s going to work. We’re gonna
give you hypothetical maid of honor situations and you will be scored on a scale of 1 to
10, 1 being the highest.
No, 10 is the highest.
Why is 10 the highest?

Because it’s the highest. (Joey shrugs his shoulders) Okay, Rachel
you’re up first. (Rachel stands up and gets ready.) Situation No. 1: You’re with
Monica, the wedding is about to start when Monica gets cold feet. Go! (Joey is playing the
part of Monica.)
(crying) I don’t want to marry Chandler!
Okay, uh…
I’ve got cold feet.
…it’s gonna be okay!

No, one man for the rest of my life? I don’t know if I can do it!
This means I’ll never get to sleep with Joey!

Look Monica, getting cold feet is very common. Y’know,
it’s-it’s just because of all the anticipation and you just have to remember
that you love Chandler. And also, I ran out on a wedding. You don’t get to keep the
gifts.

(out of his Monica character) Very good! Drawing on your own experience, I
like that!
Thanks!
Yes, very nice Rachel.
Thank you judges.
Ugh, what a kiss ass.
Oh!
Okay, Phoebe…
Yes! Your honor?

We’re now in the ceremony, Monica is about to say, "I do"
when her drunk uncle starts yelling. What do you do? Go!

(playing the drunk uncle) When Monica was a little girl, I remember
that—(Phoebe screams and tackles him)—Ooh!! Ow! Very good!
Oh!
Yes! Excellent! Perfect score!
Wait a minute! She just made a scene in the middle of the ceremony!
Hey! Do you want do you want a little taste of Pheebs?!
It is time for you to give your maid of honor speech.
Ohh, wait a minute, we haven’t pre…
Go!
Okay! Okay! Umm,
Oh! That’s nice.

Thank you. Thank you very much. Umm, I’ve known them separately and
I’ve known them together and-and to know them as a couple is to know that you are
truly in the presence of love. So I would like to raise my glass (Grabs a glass and holds
it up) to Monica and Chandler and the beautiful adventure they are about to embark upon
together. I can think of no two people better prepared for the journey.
Wow. (To Ross) Good speech.
Yeah, it really was!
Aw, thanks!

Okay Phoebe, I guess you’re next (To Joey) although I really
don’t see the point.
Yeah.

Okay, I can’t believe that Monica and Chandler are getting married.
I remember talking about this day with Rachel while we were showering together, naked.
(Raises her glass and drinks.)
And she’s back in the game.

(she opens the door) Julie hi! Chandler Bing, I, I guess you remember
me.
Hello Skidmark.
(To Monica) It’s a nickname, I’ll explain later.
It’s pretty clear.

Ah, uh, I owe you a long overdue apology. I never should have broken
up with you because you were overweight.
That’s why you broke up with me?

You-you-you didn’t know that. (Pause as she nods no.) Well, I
guess my work here is done!

All right, well first of all I would like to say that you both performed
very well. Okay? You should be proud of yourselves. And-and I would also like to say that
in this competition there are no losers. Well, except for Rachel—Damnit!
Really?! I won!
What?!
I’m sorry Rach, it was, it was really close.

Well then I demand a recount! (Hmm, I wonder where I’ve heard that
before.)
Actually, it wasn’t that close.

No! Y’know what? No! No! You thing was so stupid anyway, this was
ridiculous—We’re gonna flip a coin! (Phoebe gasps.) All right?! (She flips the
coin.) Heads! (Looks at the coin and grunts in disgust.)
The coins have finally forgiven me!

Well y’know what? I hope Monica forgives you after you throw her,
her vegetarian, voodoo, goddess circley shower! (Runs out.)

(running after her) Rach, it’s gonna be okay! (To Ross and Joey)
You guys are the best!
Boy I tell ya, that judging stuff took a lot out of me.
Yeah?

Yeah! I was thinking about maybe going upstairs and taking a little nap on
my couch. (Raises his eyebrows, questioning Ross to see if he wants to join him.)
Why-why would I care about that?

No reason, I’m just saying that uh… That’s where I’ll
be.

As bad as that went I actually enjoyed myself. I think that I’m
going to apologize for all of the stupid things I do.

Why don’t you just stop doing stupid things? Then you wouldn’t
have to apologize.
I would really love it if could do both.
All right, I…I have to ask.
What?
Are you gonna break up with me if I get fat again?
What?!

Well, you broke up with Julie Grath! How much weight could she have
gained?
A hundred and forty-five pounds.

In one year?! My God what did she eat? Her-her family! That’s not
the point.

Look I know it was a stupid reason to break up with somebody, but I
was 15!

Well… That’s not the only time this was an issue. You remember
when umm, you spent Thanksgiving with us? You called me fat.
Okay. Okay, now wait a minute that was totally different.
How?
You were not supposed to hear that! I said that behind you back!

What if I have babies, okay? I mean I’m gonna look different.
I’m okay with that, but I’m not sure that you are!

Look you have to realize I don’t think of you as a thin,
beautiful woman. (Monica glares at him.) See this is one of things that I can apologize
for later! Look, what I mean is you’re Monica! Okay? And I am in love with Monica.
Keep going.

So you can balloon up or you can shrink down and I will still love
you.
Even if I shrink down to two inches tall?
I’d carry you around in my pocket.
I love you. (They hug and kiss.)
Skidmark’s still got a way with the ladies.
Hi Pheebs.
Hi!
Hi! I just want to apologize. I’m really sorry I was a baby.

That’s ridiculous Rachel, we were all babies once. (Rachel looks at
her.) Oh, you mean today.

Yeah. Yeah, and y’know you-you deserve to win. And-and y’know
I was thinking about it, if-if you’re Monica’s maid of honor that means I get to
be yours.
Oh yeah!

Yeah! Oh, umm when-when Monica and Chandler got engaged I started
putting some stuff together, y’know just in case…
Oh that’s so sweet thanks.

Here is a book of poetry that I know Monica loves. And-and ohh God this
is funny, look, this is a picture of one Halloween where she dressed up as a bride. (Shows
Phoebe the picture.) And look, she made me carry her train, which was weird because I was
Ohh.

And umm, vintage handkerchiefs y’know ‘cause, people cry at
weddings. (Starting to cry.) I’m just gonna grab a couple of these.
This stuff is great!

Oh, I forgot this was in here. Umm, this was the uh garter that I was
saving for my wedding and I wanted it to be Monica’s something borrowed and it’s
blue. (Starts to cry again.) Yeah…

Y’know Rach, I think that, I think you should be Monica’s made
of honor.
You do? Why?
Because I think it means more to you.
But Pheebs, y’know you earned it.

Its fine. I mean, this is something that you’ve been thinking about
since you were what, 14? (She’s referring to the Halloween picture.)
No, I was ten. I just developed early.
(looking at the picture again) Man alive!
(entering) Hey, what’s going on?
Hey!
Well, we just decided that Rachel is gonna be your maid of honor.

(gasps) Ohh, wow! That’s great! (Rachel and Monica hug.) Oh wow! We
really have to start planning! I have, I have a lot of really specific ideas! We should
probably get together like four times per week. You can come over to my place; we’ll
get together before work! What do you say, 6:30, my place? I’m so excited! (Runs out
leaving Rachel completely stunned and Phoebe laughing.)

Yeah okay, you laugh now, but she’s gonna be yours. (Phoebe gets
suddenly scared.)
Great nap.
It really was.

(reacting first by jumping up) Dude! What the hell are you doing?! God!
(Heads for his room leaving Ross.)
(slowly stands up and says quietly) Excuse me. (Exits.)
